Daryl Ward.Action: Pours expired milk into his cereal without complaint.
Shows tension and distance with Sherri, no warmth or friendliness expressed.

Keeps a Glock in his pocket while stepping outside, suggesting preparedness but potentially mistrustful or guarded behavior.
Maintains a calm and measured tone despite provocation from Sherri, attempts to de-escalate the tension.
Remains focused on the situation, encourages Sherri to keep trying with job interviews despite her negativity.
Shows awareness of his environment (noticing the neighborhood activity), carries his Glock and a broom, indicating preparedness and caution.

Responds sarcastically and venomously when asked about his partner ('Save up your lunch money and ask her yourself.')

Salutes back promptly and stays on mission without slowing down.

Ignores taunts from others and remains focused on the threat.

Laughs warmly with his daughter during their interaction.

Reacts quickly to the crash outside by immediately getting up and going to see what happened.

Dismisses concerns about grass damage with a flippant remark, showing some confidence but possible disregard for property.
Tells Jakoby to shut up to avoid a minor conflict, trying to keep the peace but not handling it delicately.

Engages in sarcastic banter with Jakoby, showing informal, familiar communication.

Tells Jakoby he wouldn’t care if he publicly explained the situation, showing honesty and a desire for transparency.
Comforts Sophia, telling her he won't die and encourages her to go with Grandma despite her fears.

Affirms emotional bond with Sophia despite lack of biological connection.
Expresses frustration and anger to Jakoby about personal relationships and struggles.

Responds with strong hostility but no attempts to de-escalate tension or connect positively.

Asks about his partner proactively.
Fumes but does not immediately retaliate physically when insulted and mocked by fellow cops.

Mocks coworkers who hold onto racial grudges, calling them 'dumb-asses' unable to move past outdated hatred.

Is noticeably isolated from the 'cool kids' group at roll call, suggesting some social distance or exclusion.
Engages in playful banter with Jakoby, laughs at his jokes, and shares a light moment despite tense circumstances.
